article:
The '[[serotonin]] transporter' ('SERT') is a monoamine transporter protein.

This is an integral membrane protein that transports the neurotransmitter
serotonin from synaptic spaces into presynaptic neurons. This transport of
serotonin by the SERT protein terminates the action of serotonin and recycles it
in a sodium-dependent manner. This protein is the target of many antidepressant
medications, including those of the SSRI class. It
is a member of the family. A repeat length polymorphism in the promoter of this
gene has been shown to affect the rate of serotonin uptake and may play a role
in sudden infant death syndrome, aggressive behavior in Alzheimer disease
patients, post-traumatic stress disorder and depression-susceptibility in people
experiencing emotional trauma.
